item.title: GenerativeArt interlude
item.description:
Sunset on Paros #XQuery #SVG https://t.co/Tu8lwwCkmq
A larger sun https://t.co/t0hej81f5j
Last one: a rockier island. https://t.co/SrxEBnFhYW

All these incredibly bad takes about Ohio's anti-trans anti-girl anti-sports law, buying into the idea that "fairness" demands something like it. Pfeh. Fairness, where to even start? Look, I've played youth sport. I've coached youth sport. Boys and girls, hundreds of 'em
You know what ALL those kids have in common? Every last blessed one of them?
They just want to hang out with their friends and play
They want to have a feeling of joy in camaraderie and movement
That's it.
So let them.
Were there huge variations in physical ability and skill Yes, huge
Some of those kids had extra training, off-season teams. Fair? Not really.
We had asthmatics trying to run for an hour on grass Fair? Not really.
We had kids trying to stick with Ramadan fasting restrictions and play tournaments. Fair? Not really.
This being soccer the best players had the "unfair" advantage of growing up where everyone played and watched their whole lives vs those who first kicked a ball last week
Some of *those* girls, man, they could have run circles round most of the boys
And frankly, as they teach you in ref school, the girls are way more aggressive w/ each other, so stick your stereotypes about poor fragile girls in the bin where it belongs
Of all the hundreds of kids I coached, maybe two had the skill and athleticism to maybe make a top-tier high-school level club team. Maybe.
Sure, sports parents are crazy, but folks, none of your darlings is getting the free-ride to Stanford, much less a pro contract.
Chillax.
Let the kids play
You don't need to have some creep probe your daughter's innards to protect the sacred integrity of youth sports
There is no sacred integrity
The kids just want to hang with their friends and have fun
So let them
Thus endeth the rant

item.title: GenerativeArt interlude
item.description:
A study in symmetry #XQuery #SVG https://t.co/dQrunQ5ViN
The basic skeleton is formed with a random sequence of horizontal and vertical lines, which is then mutated with a random series of horizontal and vertical flips, inversions, and reversals. Flip those two paths through horizontal and vertical to get the symmetry https://t.co/5Y9Y2kg3Bi
There's a lot of variation in the design from this simple algorithm https://t.co/iw6nB7GWqk
Solid colouring with contrasting lines https://t.co/L2GrVCgnms
Gradient colouring, showing some of the variability https://t.co/odmEYI01HZ
Solid colouring gives a different vibe https://t.co/hgzq4MOQJU
Incomplete symmetry: when we only include the horizontally flipped and vertically flipped variants, but not the variant that flips both https://t.co/4rwb0g8m3u
